headline: In Threat to Block Bolton, Trump Tests Limits of Executive Privilege
abstract: If senators vote to subpoena testimony for the impeachment trial, the president may not be able to block or delay a willing witness.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON â€” Republican senators allied with President Trump are increasingly arguing that the Senate should not call witnesses or subpoena documents for his impeachment trial because Mr. Trump has threatened to invoke executive privilege, and a legal fight would take too long to resolve.
keywords: Trump-Ukraine Whistle-blower Complaint and Impeachment Inquiry
